com.bmwcarit.barefoot.markov

Class Filter<C extends StateCandidate<C,T,S>,T extends StateTransition,S extends Sample>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bmwcarit.barefoot.markov.Filter<C,T,S>
  • Type Parameters:
    C - Candidate inherits from StateCandidate.
    T - Transition inherits from StateTransition.
    S - Sample inherits from Sample.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Matcher

    public abstract class Filter<C extends StateCandidate<C,T,S>,T extends StateTransition,S extends Sample>
extends Object
    Hidden Markov Model (HMM) filter for online and offline inference of states in a stochastic process.

    • Method Detail

      • candidates

        protected abstract Set<Tuple<C,Double>> candidates(S sample)
        Gets state vector, i.e. a set of StateCandidate objects and with its emission probability.
        Parameters:
        sample - Measurement sample.
        Returns:
        Set of tuples consisting of a StateCandidate and its emission probability.

      • transition

        protected abstract Tuple<T,Double> transition(Tuple<S,C> predecessor,
                                              Tuple<S,C> candidate)
        Gets transition and its transition probability for a pair of StateCandidates, i.e. a candidate st and its predecessor st
        Parameters:
        predecessor - Tuple of predecessor state candidate st-1 and its respective measurement sample.
        candidate - Tuple of state candidate st and its respective measurement sample.
        Returns:
        Tuple consisting of the transition from st-1 to st and its transition probability, or null if there is no transition.

      • transitions

        protected Map<C,Map<C,Tuple<T,Double>>> transitions(Tuple<S,Set<C>> predecessors,
                                                    Tuple<S,Set<C>> candidates)
        Gets transitions and its transition probabilities for each pair of state candidates st and st-1.

        Note: This method may be overridden for better performance, otherwise it defaults to the method transition(com.bmwcarit.barefoot.util.Tuple<S, C>, com.bmwcarit.barefoot.util.Tuple<S, C>) for each single pair of state candidate and its possible predecessor.

        Parameters:
        predecessors - Tuple of a set of predecessor state candidate st-1 and its respective measurement sample.
        candidates - Tuple of a set of state candidate st and its respective measurement sample.
        Returns:
        Maps each predecessor state candidate st-1 ∈ St-1 to a map of state candidates st ∈ St containing all transitions from st-1 to st and its transition probability, or null if there no transition.

      • execute

        public Set<C> execute(Set<C> predecessors,
                      S previous,
                      S sample)
        Executes Hidden Markov Model (HMM) filter iteration that determines for a given measurement sample zt, i.e. a Sample object, and of a predecessor state vector St-1, i.e. a set of StateCandidate objects, a state vector St with filter and sequence probabilities set.

        Note: The set of state candidates St-1 is allowed to be empty. This is either the initial case or an HMM break occured, i.e. no state candidates representing the measurement sample could be found.

        Parameters:
        predecessors - State vector St-1, which may be empty.
        sample - Measurement sample zt.
        previous - Previous measurement sample zt-1.
        Returns:
        State vector St, which may be empty if an HMM break occured.
